author: draganrakita
content:
In EOF validation we have: 
`no unreachable sections are allowed, i.e. every section is referenced by at least one non-recursive CALLF or JUMPF, and section 0 is implicitly reachable.`
Should we check that all section have a connection from section 0?

author: fivedogit
content: If we were to use EOF to ban new appearances of ORIGIN in smart contracts (as discussed here https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/718596092828057631/1210690513750073394), would it make sense for this ban to occur in the same hardfork as EOF or should it wait for a subsequent one? (BTW, there is no EIP for this yet.)

author: _shemnon
content: If we ban an opcode we have to bump the version number of EOF.  So if we ban it the best way would be at the first appearance of EOF.

author: _shemnon
content: Personally, I want to wait 2-5 years (or forever) before we have to bump the EOF version number.  We can always re-add it if we were wrong.

author: _shemnon
content: The overhead for banning an opode is amlost entierly in test verification.

author: fivedogit
content: Okay. Good to know. Thank you.
